content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Sure! Here is the function `clean_column` written in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a column name as input, converts it to lower case (ensuring all characters are alphanumeric), strips any leading or trailing whitespaces and replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores.
